required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating How Patients With Acute Coronary Syndrome Are Managed During 2 Years After Discharge
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Follow-up of Antithrombotic Management Patterns in Acute Coronary Syndrome Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this international study is to describe the short- and long-term (i.e. up to 2 years following the index event) antithrombotic management patterns (AMPs) in patients hospitalized for acute coronary syndromes (ST segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI), Non-ST-Segment Elevation Acute Coronary Syndrome (NSTE-ACS)), and to document the impact of AMPs in clinical outcomes, economic variables and quality of life in a 'real-life' setting and to compare these between sites, countries and regions.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical outcomes (ischemic and bleeding) incidence and time to these clinical outcomes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Longitudinal during 2 years after index event (phone calls to the patients at 6 weeks and each 3 months after index event)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Longitudinal during 2 years after index event (phone calls to the patients at 6 weeks and each 3 months after index event)
Longitudinal during 2 years after index event (phone calls to the patients at 6 weeks and each 3 months after index event)
At index event (baseline) and then at 6 weeks and each 3 months after index event

arm_group.description: Patients, older than 18, hospitalized within 24 hours of onset of symptoms and diagnosed with UA, STEMI or NSTEMI

study_pop.textblock:
Patients hospitalized within 24 hours of onset of symptoms and diagnosed with unstable angina (UA), STEMI or non-STEMI(NSTEMI). Patients will be invited to participate by the hospital (Academic or Community) which is going to discharge the patient.
Participating investigators will belong to hospitals (Academic, Community, with/without cathlab, etc), in the proportion representing the reality of where this kind of patients are managed in each country.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of myocardial infarction or unstable angina
- Hospitalized for the first time within 24 hours of onset of symptoms
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any condition/circumstance which in the opinion of the investigator could significantly limit the complete follow up of the patient (e.g. tourist, non-native speaker or does not understand the local language, psychiatric disturbances)
- Current participation in a clinical trial.
